WARFAREMemorandum by the Minister of SupplyIn the field of biological warfare the Ministry of Supply receivesvaluable help and advice from the Biological Research AdvisoryBoard which includes a number of leading scientists from outside theGovernment service.2. Members of the Board have been disturbed by reports of thescale on which the Americans are providing themselves with themeans of offensive biological warfare. They fear that these preparationsI may imply a policy at variance with the Geneva Protocol of 1925, whichbinds the signatories not, among other things, to use bacteriologicalweapons so long as the enemy refrains from doing so. The UnitedStates are not parties to the Protocol.3. In view of our close collaboration with the United States onbiological warfare research, the Board have asked me for aclarification of the Government's policy in this regard.I 4. I ask for authority to assure the Board privately thatHer Majesty's Government intend to honour their obligations underthe Geneva Protocol.Ministry of Supply, S. W. 1.,I 23RD JUNE, 1952.
